abstract.p: Neuberger Berman Inc shares rise 5 percent to record high of $68.38 on speculation that company, money manager that caters to wealthy people, could be bought in what would be latest in series of acquisitions of fund companies (S)

block.p: Neuberger Berman Inc. shares jumped 5 percent to a record high on speculation that the company, a money manager that caters to wealthy people, could be bought in what would be the latest in a series of acquisitions of fund companies.
Shares of Neuberger, which went public last October at $32, climbed $3.63, to $68.38. Since Sept. 27, the shares have surged 13.7 percent.

Neuberger Berman Inc. shares jumped 5 percent to a record high on speculation that the company, a money manager that caters to wealthy people, could be bought in what would be the latest in a series of acquisitions of fund companies.
Shares of Neuberger, which went public last October at $32, climbed $3.63, to $68.38. Since Sept. 27, the shares have surged 13.7 percent.
Jeffrey Lane, chief executive of Neuberger, which has a $3.3 billion market value, declined to comment. ''If we had something to report, we'd report it,'' he said.

Neuberger had $54.4 billion under management as of June 30. The firm's high-net-worth business would be especially attractive to an acquirer, as firms that specialize in rich clients are scarce, said William Katz, an analyst at Merrill Lynch, which rates the company a long-term buy.
